metadata.title: CVE-2012-5370 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
JRuby computes hash values without properly restricting the ability totrigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependentattackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted inputto an application that maintains a hash table, as demonstrated by auniversal multicollision attack against the MurmurHash2 algorithm, adifferent vulnerability than CVE-2011-4838.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5370` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 1.5.6-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jruby package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.6-5').
